edu.kit.cm.kitcampusguide.datalayer.poidb
Class DefaultPOIDB

java.lang.Object
  edu.kit.cm.kitcampusguide.datalayer.poidb.DefaultPOIDB
All Implemented Interfaces:
POIDB
public class DefaultPOIDB
extends Object
implements POIDB

Realizes a POIDB via a rational database. The database connection is established with JDBC.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Stefan

getInstance

public static POIDB getInstance()
Returns the single instance of DefaultPOIDB.

Returns:

init

public static void init(String dbURL,
                        POIDBSearcher searcher,
                        boolean create)
                 throws SQLException
Initializes a DefaultPOIDB working with a given database. The tables are created if necessary, in this case write access is needed.
An appropriate JDBC driver must be registered. Additionally, the caller has to specify the used search algorithm.

Parameters:
dbURL - the database URL, see DriverManager.getConnection(java.lang.String, java.util.Properties)
create - true, if the method should create all required tables. If the tables have been created before they will be overriden!
searcher - the search algorithm which is used by this database.
Throws:
SQLException - if a database error occurred
NullPointerException - if dbURL or searcher is null
IllegalStateException - if the POIDB is already initialized

getPOIsBySearch

public List<POI> getPOIsBySearch(String text)
Description copied from interface: POIDB
Returns all POIs matching a given search term. It should be possible to search for the stored POI names.

Specified by:
getPOIsBySearch in interface POIDB
Parameters:
text - an arbitrary search string. The implementation might need to escape the string correctly.
Returns:
a list with POIs matching the search term. The list's POIs are ordered by their relevance, if no match was found an empty list is returned.

getBuildingPOI

public POI getBuildingPOI(int buildingID)
Description copied from interface: POIDB
Returns the building POI for a given building id. The building POI is a POI describing a building.

Specified by:
getBuildingPOI in interface POIDB
Parameters:
buildingID - a building id
Returns:
the building poi for a given building or null if no appropriate building could be found.
